docs.snippet: Isabel Rose, the New York real estate heiress, decided to go public about her child’s gender transition after President Trump rescinded federal protections for transgender students.

headline.main: My Son, My Daughter: A Mother’s Evolution

docs.snippet: Eugene Richards will have his first retrospective exhibit at the George Eastman Museum in Rochester, spanning over 45 years of work.

headline.main: Eugene Richards: A Life in Photography

docs.abstract: Eugene Richards will have his first retrospective exhibit at the George Eastman Museum in Rochester, spanning over 45 years of work.

docs.snippet: Susan Faludi’s latest book, about her photographer father’s transition to a woman, originally had no photos. In time she realized that images are moments carved disingenuously out of continuous experience, but they can be redeemed by a...

headline.main: Susan Faludi: ‘In My World, Photographs Lie’

docs.abstract: Susan Faludi’s latest book, about her photographer father’s transition to a woman, originally had no photos. In time she realized that images are moments carved disingenuously out of continuous experience, but they can be redeemed by age.

docs.snippet: The vendors are a fixture of New York streets and appetites, yet they struggle daily with weather, logistics and rules. Here’s the story of one.

headline.print_headline: A Day in the Lunch Box
headline.main: A Day in the Life of a Food Vendor

docs.snippet: In the waterlogged Netherlands, climate change is considered neither a hypothetical nor a drag on the economy. Instead, it’s an opportunity.

headline.main: The Dutch Have Solutions to Rising Seas. The World Is Watching.

docs.snippet: Why do America’s black gay and bisexual men have a higher H.I.V. rate than any country in the world?
Ben Platt wrecks himself onstage in “Dear Evan Hansen.” Surviving it takes practice — and has made him a favorite to win a Tony Award.

headline.main: How a 23-Year-Old With Mild Anxiety and a Charmed Life Became the Lying, Sobbing, Lovesick Toast of Broadway

docs.snippet: Mr. O’Brien, a man for all New York seasons, in the arts, fashion, music and media, died last week at age 70.

headline.print_headline: Glenn O’Brien’s Friends Remember a ‘Successful Maniac’
headline.main: Glenn O’Brien’s Friends Remember a ‘Successful Maniac’

docs.snippet: Maryland seemed to be a natural sanctuary for undocumented immigrants. But some vocal critics said the proposals devalued their own struggles to gain citizenship.

headline.main: Sanctuary Bills in Maryland Faced a Surprise Foe: Legal Immigrants

docs.snippet: Since November, viewers have flocked to liberal commentators on cable news — while Olbermann, who pioneered the field, rails against Trump from a GQ photo studio.

headline.print_headline: Keith Olbermann Was Once Cable News’s Liberal Standard-Bearer. Now He’s Missing Its Boom Times.
